problem.markdown:
Review the Outliers dashboard. Reset the dashboard configuration as follows:
Data - Immunisation, Period - August 2021, Boundary - National, Disaggregation - District
Set the Options as follows: Under "Display Columns" select Outliers, then select Include Z-Score. Next, under the Outlier Filter, select the Modified Z-Score and set to Extreme.
Sort the data table by modified z-score. Based on the modified z-score which district has suspicious values with the highest deviation from the non-supicious values for BCG given less then 1?
>>Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts)<<
( ) A. C-5 ( ) B. B-4 (x) C. C-6 ( ) D. C-1
[explanation] The correct answer is C-6. From the data table, we see that this has a higher modified z-score then other districts that have identified outliers for BCG given less then 1. This z-scores help us determine how much these outlier valies deviate from the other reported values within a given period. The higher the z-score, the higher the deviation. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.p: Review the Outliers dashboard. Reset the dashboard configuration as follows:
Data - Immunisation, Period - August 2021, Boundary - National, Disaggregation - District
Under "Display Columns" select Outliers, then select Include Z-Score. Next, under the Outlier Filter, select the Modified Z-Score and set to Extreme.
Sort the data table by modified z-score. Based on the modified z-score which district has suspicious values with the highest deviation from the non-supicious values for BCG given less then 1?
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts)

div.p: The correct answer is C-6. From the data table, we see that this has a higher modified z-score then other districts that have identified outliers for BCG given less then 1. This z-scores help us determine how much these outlier valies deviate from the other reported values within a given period. The higher the z-score, the higher the deviation.
